body_html: Hi @terrydlca We are tracking this internally as TF Lite shouldn't destroy (overwrite with intermediates) input tensors even on self-allocated buffers. Meanwhile, you can use -c 100 to measure overall performance, but accuracy of repeated inference without refreshing the input buffers will be incorrect.
body_text: Hi @terrydlca  We are tracking this internally as TF Lite shouldn't destroy (overwrite with intermediates) input tensors even on self-allocated buffers. Meanwhile, you can use -c 100 to measure overall performance, but accuracy of repeated inference without refreshing the input buffers will be incorrect.
body: Hi @terrydlca  We are tracking this internally as TF Lite shouldn't destroy (overwrite with intermediates) input tensors even on self-allocated buffers. Meanwhile, you can use -c 100 to measure overall performance, but accuracy of repeated inference without refreshing the input buffers will be incorrect.
